thread.title: Cleveland Browns' Gary Barnidge's miraculous NFL catch? Great, but not the greatest
thread.title_full: Cleveland Browns' Gary Barnidge's miraculous NFL catch? Great, but not the greatest

title: Cleveland Browns' Gary Barnidge's miraculous NFL catch? Great, but not the greatest
text:

Top 5 NFL catches of all time Watch the top 5 NFL catches of all time.
PT2M11S 620 349 Cleveland Browns tight end Gary Barnidge put an early nomination forward for catch of the season after a ridiculous grab using his legs on Monday.
Josh McCown threw a looping ball in to Barnidge, who appeared to have spilled what looked like a relatively simple catch.
However, the ball somehow gets wedged between his legs as he falls to the ground. Replays showed the ball never touched the ground as Barnidge scooped the pigskin up with his legs and back into the safety of his arms.
Incredible completion: Cleveland Browns tight end Gary Barnidge grabs the ball. Photo: AP
The unbelievable catch gave Cleveland a 18-yard touchdown and a 22-21 fourth quarter lead.
Advertisement It remains a mystery how the ball did not hit the turf; a catch for the ages.
Utterly ridiculous skills. But it still doesn't make our top five catches in recent memory.
5) Marty Booker vs Detroit Lions 2008
Booker pulled off a 30-yard catch despite a defender getting in his way and blocking him off the ball. His view is somewhat impeded, but he manages to put his left hand out and take a clean one-handed grab while getting a flag in the process.
It is regarded as one of the most underrated catches of all time.
4) Randy Moss vs New York Jets 2010
The Patriots receiver made a seriously good overhead catch courtesy of a pinpoint-accurate Tom Brady throw.
The 34-yard touchdown was impressive for the fact it just beat the hands of Jets cornerback Darrelle Revis and landed perfectly into Moss' outstretched right hand.
3) David Tyree vs New England Patriots 2008
The 'helmet catch' as it's referred to, occurred in the final two minutes of the 2008 Superbowl.
The most amazing thing about the entire play was how New York Giants' quarterback Eli Manning managed to avoid being tackled by three Patriots defensive players.
After breaking free, Manning sets his sights down field and finds Tyree, who makes a sensational catch by more or less pulling the ball into his helmet as he falls to the ground.
From there the Giants scored a Superbowl-winning touchdown.
2) Antonio Freeman vs Vikings 2000
On a rainy Monday night in overtime with the scores locked at 20-all, Brett Favre threw in a pass for Freeman.
Freeman slipped, the ball hit him in the back, before he somehow managed to have the awareness to pick the ball up before it hit the turf.
Other players nearby were convinced it was a non-catch, but Freeman streaked away to score the match-winning touchdown.
1) Odell Beckham Jr vs Dallas Cowboys 2014
In his first NFL season, Beckham catches the ball so far over his head it almost defies belief for one of the all-time great touchdowns.
Words do not do it justice.
